intro: Sabulina nuttallii var. gracilis, commonly known as slender sandwort, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the western United States. It typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features small, clustered leaves and produces delicate white or pale pink flowers in early spring. Its growth habit is prostrate, with stems that often root at the nodes. The species is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy member of the Caryophyllaceae family.
